page.title: 09FARMING - Lydham/More
page.content: {CROPS} Agricultural land ranges from high ground eligible for Hill Subsidies down to lowland suitable for arable crops. {Sizes of farms}range from 2 hectare smallholdings to 200 hectare mixed farms. A cold wet Spring and Summer have made harvesting difficult and reduced yields. Hay- making suffered but up to 4 cuts of silage grown, either baled or clamped. Small areas of Oil Seed Rape, Potatoes and Peas grown as{alternative crops, due to over-production of corn in past years. Mainly winter corn, few spring varieties. Varieties, yields per hectare and average prices per Ton:- {Wheat;Coppain, Norman, Longbow 7 Â£110 {Barley;Igri, Sonja, Panda 7 Â£ 95 {Oats;Pennyarth, Pennal 5 Â£100 {Potatoes;Pentland Dell } {43 Â£ 40 {Oil Seed Rape;Bien Venue, 3 Â£270 {Peas;Progretta (for canning) 3 Â£170
